Bob mugged a man. He had no choice. The Underground was so much harsher than he expected. He needed the money to survive. He had pigs to pet, birds to chase, dogs to bark at. This place was not for him. He couldn’t twist random peoples’ arms anymore. So he went into a decaled shop and mugged a man. He had no choice. He became deaf to the screams of protest and the gasps of shock as he punched a man in the pee pee and took his wallet. Later he will rip the wallet open and savagely pull out all 10,000 Yen in it before stuffing it in his mouth and shaking it. The madness of the free week has barely descended, but the effect was already far too late.

But the deed was done. Bob mugged a man. He had no choice.
